title: Contributor Code of Conduct
text: contributors maintainers project, pledge respect people contribute reporting issues, posting feature requests, updating documentation, submitting pull requests patches, activities. committed making participation project harassment-free experience everyone, regardless level experience, gender, gender identity expression, sexual orientation, disability, personal appearance, body size, race, ethnicity, age, religion. Examples unacceptable behavior participants include use sexual language imagery, derogatory comments personal attacks, trolling, public private harassment, insults, unprofessional conduct. Project maintainers right responsibility remove, edit, reject comments, commits, code, wiki edits, issues, contributions aligned Code Conduct. Project maintainers follow Code Conduct may removed project team. Instances abusive, harassing, otherwise unacceptable behavior may reported opening issue contacting one project maintainers. Code Conduct adapted Contributor Covenant (http://contributor-covenant.org), version 1.0.0, available http://contributor-covenant.org/version/1/0/0/

title: Authors and Citation
Authors and Citation
text: Zheng B (2025). expDB: Database Experiment Dataset. R package version 0.1.0, https://expdb.bangyou./.
code: @Manual{,   title = {expDB: Database for Experiment Dataset},   author = {Bangyou Zheng},   year = {2025},   note = {R package version 0.1.0},   url = {https://expdb.bangyou.me/}, }

title: Database for Experiment Dataset
text: R interface expDB used store experiment-based data.

title: Database for Experiment Dataset
text: Install CRAN. Install developing version Github.

title: Database for Experiment Dataset
text: SQLite database used store information experiment-based data. Researchers collect basic information researchers, e.g. name, email, etc. ApSoils specify soil name ApSoils distribute APSIM. Sites collect basic information experiment fields, e.g. name, latitude, longitude, soil, etc. soil must table ApSoils. Met specify information weather records, e.g. type filename. valid met types include “daily” “hourly”. Genotypes collect genotype name information. Traits collect information traits, e.g. name, type, label, unit description. aren’t limitation trait names types. normally use crop soil trait types. Trials collect basic information trials, e.g. year, site, trial code (trialcode), sowing, density, depth, row spacing (rowspacing) researcher met. Trial code must unique expDB. Site come table Sites. Design specify design plot, e.g. year, trialcode, site, row (range), column (plot), replicate, block, treatment, genotype, etc. plot specifies year, site, row, column must unique. trialcode table Trials, site table Sites, genotype table Genotypes. TrialSoils collect soil information trials, e.g. trial code, bulk density, no3-n, nh4-n, etc. Irrigation collect irrigation information trials, e.g. date, amount, etc. Fertilization collect fertilization information trials, e.g. date, fertilizer, amount, etc.

title: Database for Experiment Dataset
text: experiment-based data can imported excel file supports readxl package. expDB case-insensitive. Australia style used date related fields (dd/mm/yyyy).

title: Database for Experiment Dataset
text: processes plant growth development can classified several hierarchical levels, e.g. biosphere, ecosystem cropping system, field plot, whole plant, plant organ, cell, molecule, atom, subatomic particle (Hodges 1991). collect data field, plant, organ agricultural experiment. values higher levels can derived lower levels. cases, don’t directly record data levels , specific protocol. observations used derive values levels. example, population converted establishment counts; dry weights leaves, stems, heads converted quadrat harvest. extra level, measurement added convention. list traits provided released version expDB.

title: Database for Experiment Dataset
text: low level function dbGetPhenotype provided extract raw observations database. traits can observed calculated traits.

title: Database for Experiment Dataset
text: plant population (F_Population) defined number plants unit area. F_Population retrived database, calculated measurement establishment count (M_EstablishmentCount) row spacing (RowSpacing). density assumed equal population none traits specified database.

title: Database for Experiment Dataset
text: Final leaf number (O_FinalLeafNumber) defined total completed leaf number fertile stem head emergence (main stem tillers). O_FinalLeafNumber retrived database, calculated Haun Index. Huan Index assumed full expanded flag leaf recorded. Consequently maximum integer value observations treated O_FinalLeafNumber.

what: Stem/tiller numbers for field and plant
title: Database for Experiment Dataset
text: stem/tiller numbers defined number stems/tillers per unit area per plant. relationships among 4 traits follows. P_StemNumber=P_TillerNumber+1P\_StemNumber = P\_TillerNumber + 1F_StemNumber=P_StemNumber×F_PopulationF\_StemNumber = P\_StemNumber \times F\_PopulationF_TillerNumber=P_TillerNumber×F_PopulationF\_TillerNumber = P\_TillerNumber \times F\_PopulationF_StemNumber=(P_TillerNumber+1)×F_PopulationF\_StemNumber = (P\_TillerNumber + 1) \times F\_Population stem/tiller numbers retrived observations, calculated traits.

what: Approximate Date for a Target Zadoks Stage — approx_zadoks
title: Approximate Date for a Target Zadoks Stage — approx_zadoks
text: function estimates date corresponding specified target Zadoks stage interpolating known Zadoks stages associated dates. Phenology Analysis Functions

title: Approximate Date for a Target Zadoks Stage — approx_zadoks
Approximate Date for a Target Zadoks Stage — approx_zadoks
text: zadoks numeric vector Zadoks growth stages (51 69). date vector dates (class Date) corresponding Zadoks stage. target single numeric value indicating target Zadoks stage estimate date.

title: Approximate Date for a Target Zadoks Stage — approx_zadoks
text: Date object representing interpolated date target Zadoks stage, NA target outside observed range.

title: Approximate Date for a Target Zadoks Stage — approx_zadoks
text: module provides methods analyzing phenological data, particularly focusing Zadoks scale. following two methods implemented: 1. **Relative Date Observed Target (Zadoks Rounded):**    - target phenological stage observed dataset (rounding Zadoks values), function use relative date corresponding observation. allows precise tracking phenological events based actual recorded data. 2. **Linear Interpolation Target within Observed Range:**    - target Zadoks stage directly observed falls within range observed stages, function estimates date using linear interpolation nearest observed stages. provides approximate date target stage based trend observed data.

title: Approximate Date for a Target Zadoks Stage — approx_zadoks
text: Ensure input data includes Zadoks stage observations corresponding dates accurate analysis.

title: Approximate Date for a Target Zadoks Stage — approx_zadoks
